Prijoviću opomena iz vrha kluba: Moraće debelo da plati, ako želi da ode
Neće srpskom napadaču biti lako da napusti Al Itihad

02 Nov 2019


Vest da bi Aleksandar Prijović mogao da se vrati u evropski fudbal nepunih godinu dana pošto je potpisao vrtoglavi ugovor s Al Itihadom izazvala je lančanu reakciju, a čelnim ljudima kluba definitivno se nisu dopale ovakve najave u medijima. 

Ubrzo pošto su se pojavile prve spekulacije oglasio se prvi čovek Al Itihada Anmar al Kali koji je u ime kluba i glavnog finansijera Arab grupe koju zastupa poslao vrlo jasnu poruku Prijoviću – ako želiš da odeš, moraćeš debelo da platiš!“Nećemo dozvoliti Prijoviću da ode ukoliko ne bude ispoštovao ugovor. Niko nije iznad kluba“, kratko je poručio Al Kali.
Kako se može čuti, predsednik Al Itihada od Prijovića traži da se odrekne preostalog novca iz ugovora vrednog ukupno 40.000.000 evra sa bonusima, ali i da plati veliku sumu novca za čiste papire. Nije poznato o kojoj sumi je reč, ali Prijović bi mogao ozbiljno da se namuči kako bi dobio slobodu koju traži.
Podsetimo, problemi srpskog reprezentativca počeli su onog trenutka kada je došlo do smene rukovodstva u klubu iz Saudijske Arabije i odlaska bivšeg predsednika Leoba Nasera s kojim je imao poseban odnos. Prijović je ostao bez saigrača Rodrigeza s kojim je imao odličnu saradnju, posle čega je izgubio svoj uticaj na terenu.
Prijović s Al Itihadom ima ugovor do juna 2023. godine.
U Grčkoj tvrde da će se Prijović vratiti u solunski PAOK gde je doživeo pun fudbalski procvat u karijeri i zaslužio basnoslovni ugovor u Saudijskoj Arabiji.

The man who never played Final Fantasy VII: a short film about the fascinating phenomenon of the Japanese JRPG
02 Nov 2019 by Diario Tecnología
Less than 22 years ago Final Fantasy VII was published worldwide, and although the adventures of Cloud and the rest of AVALANCHA still resonate today, not all have lived with the same intensity. Or, simply, they have not lived them.
This weekend, the FUJI TV network has issued a very special short film on the occasion of the increasingly upcoming release of Final Fantasy VII Remake. One that, paradoxically, is starring someone who has never played it.
After discovering one of the original Final Fantasy VII CDs, a young office worker played by Masataka Kubota is discovering the memories and sensations of those around him. His girlfriend, his boss, his co-workers and even a staunch fan of the Squaresoft game with which he shares a restaurant.






In Extra Life Final Fantasy VII: what it was like to play the classic in 1997 and what it is like to return in 2019
Different views around the same phenomenon and a masterful review of his strengths and everything that made him special, such as his captivating characters, his exciting story, his playable mechanics that resulted in exciting mechanics.
But also memories of youth of people who are in another phase of his life and who, on the occasion of the launch of the remake, see how those feelings come back to surface. Including the fact of sharing the games with your loved ones.



Very special mention to the super-otaku interpreted by Testuji Tamayama, who in the middle of a restaurant effusively shows the protagonist a guide of Final Fantasy VII in a fairly tanned state. A book referred to as "his bible."
Unfortunately, the seven-minute short film is only available in Japanese. At least for now. But, although the dialogues are lost, it is possible to perfectly understand the message.



In the end, the passion around the game manages to arouse in the protagonist of the short film the interest in the phenomenon, asking his girlfriend if he wants to live with him the launch of Final Fantasy VII Remake.
As an extra, here is the extended version of it, broadcast through the Square Enix channel, of no less than thirteen minutes.
